1.label: Paddle Control
1.description: Normal mode: Upper paddle turns the light on, lower paddle turns the light off.  Reverse mode: Upper paddle turns the light off, lower paddle turns the light on.  Toggle mode: Either paddle toggles the light.

2.label: LED Indication Control
2.description: LED Indication light function.  Normal has the LED Indication on when the switch is off, off when the switch is on.

4.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer Duration
4.description: Time, in minutes, for auto-off timer delay.

6.label: Auto Turn-On Timer Duration
6.description: Set the time (in minutes) after which you want the switch to automatically turn on once it has been turned off.

7.label: Association Reports
7.description: Choose which physical and Z-Wave triggers should prompt the switch to send a status change report to associated devices.

options.label: physical tap on connected 3-way switch only
physical tap on ZEN27 or connected 3-way switch
physical tap on ZEN27 or Z-Wave command from hub
physical tap on connected 3-way switch or Z-Wave command from hub
physical tap on ZEN27 / connected 3-way switch or Z-Wave command from hub
physical tap on ZEN27 or timer
physical tap on connected 3-way switch or timer
physical tap on ZEN27 / connected 3-way switch or timer
Z-Wave command from hub or timer
physical tap on ZEN27, Z-Wave command from hub, or timer
physical tap on ZEN27 / connected 3-way switch, Z-Wave command from hub, or timer

8.label: On Off Status After Power Failure
8.description: Status after power failure.  Off: always turn light off.  On: always turn light on.  Restore: remember the latest state and restore that state.

9.label: Ramp Rate Control
9.description: Adjust the physical ramp rate for your dimmer (fade-in / fade-out effect for on / off operation). Values correspond to the number of seconds it take for the dimmer to reach full brightness or turn off when operated manually. This setting is for physical taps only, see parameter 17 to adjust Z-Wave ramp rate. Values: 1 – 99 (seconds). 0 – instant on/off. Default: 1

10.label: Minimum Brightness
10.description: Set the minimum brightness level (in %) for your dimmer. You won't be able to dim the light below the set value.

11.label: Maximum Brightness
11.description: Set the maximum brightness level (in %) for your dimmer. You won't be able to add brightness to the light beyond the set value. Note: if Parameter 12 is set to value "Full", Parameter 11 is automatically disabled.

12.label: Double Tap Function
12.description: Double Tap action.  When set to Full, turns light on to 100%.  If set to Maximum Level, turns light on to % set in Parameter 11.

13.label: Enable/Disable Scene Control
13.description: Enable or Disable scene control functionality for quick double tap triggers.

14.label: Enable/Disable Double-tap
14.description: Enables/Disables the double-tap function and assign brightness to single tap.  Last level: single tap returns to last brightness level.  Full/Max level: single tap returns to full/max level

15.label: Smart Bulb Mode: Enable/Disable Paddle / Z-Wave Control
15.description: Enable or disable local on/off control. If enabled, you’ll only be able to control the connected light via Z-Wave. Scenes and other functionality will still be available through paddles.

options.label: physical paddle and Z-Wave control disabled

16.label: Physical Dimming Speed
16.description: Set the time it takes to get from 0% to 100% brightness when pressing and holding the paddle (physical dimming). The number entered as value corresponds to the number of seconds. Default: 4

17.label: Zwave Ramp Rate Control
17.description: Choose if you want to set the Z-Wave ramp rate independently of the physical ramp rate (using an appropriate command in your hub) or if you want them to match.

options.label: Z-Wave ramp rate matches the physical ramp rate set in parameter 9
Z-Wave ramp rate is set independently using appropriate Z-Wave commands (default)

18.label: Custom Brightness Level On
18.description: Set the custom brightness level (instead of the last set brightness level) you want the dimmer to come on to when you single tap the upper paddle. Default: 0 - last brightness level

20.label: Zwave tap and hold Control
20.description: Choose how you'd like the dimmer to report when paddles are tapped and held and physical / Z-Wave control is enabled or disabled.

options.label: report each brightness level to hub when physical / Z-Wave control is disabled for physical dimming (final level only reported if physical / Z-Wave control is enabled)
report final brightness level only for physical dimming, regardless of the physical / Z-Wave control mode

21.label: Reporting behavior with disabled physical control
21.description: Set reporting behavior for disabled physical control.

options.label: switch reports on/off status and changes LED indicator state even if physical and Z-Wave control is disabled (default)
switch doesn't report on/off status or change LED indicator state when physical (and Z-Wave) control is disabled

22.label: Night Light Mode
22.description: Set the brightness level the dimmer will turn on to when off and when lower paddle is held DOWN for a second. Default: 20
